citation.article-title: Legionella gresilensis sp. nov. and Legionella beliardensis sp. nov., isolated from water in France.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Legionella beliardensis sp. nov.
Legionella beliardensis (be.li.ar.den'sis. M.L. adj. beliardensis pertaining to Montbéliard, France, whose classical Latin name was Montem Beliardae)
Gram-negative rod with a single polar flagellum.
Positive for catalase, gelatinase and presence of β-lactamase.
Negative for urease, nitrate reduction, acid production from D-glucose, browning of tyrosine agar and hippurate hydrolysis.
Some strains are positive for the Voges-Proskauer test.
DFA and SAT results exhibit no serological cross-reaction with any other Legionella species.
All strains were isolated from water samples from a single French city, Montbéliard.
The type strain is Montbéliard A1T (=ATCC 700512T=CIP 106632T), isolated from a calorifier in a hospital in Montbéliard (France).
It has a G+­C content of 38 mol%.
Strains Montbéliard A2 (=ATCC 700760), Montbéliard A3, Montbéliard A4 and Montbéliard A5 are additional strains of this species.
